devalue.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money
devalue.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Nigeria has just devalued its currency.
devalue.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make someone or something seem less important or valuable
devalue.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: History has tended to devalue the contributions of women.
devalue.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to cause something to lose its value
devalue.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Heavy price discounting will devalue our famous brands.
devalue.translation[1].definitions[1].de: when a country devalues its currency against other currencies, it decreases its value for economic reasons, for example to make its exports cheaper
devalue.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Hungary said it will devalue its currency by an average of 15% against major Western currencies.
devalue.translation[1].definitions[2].de: when a country’s currency devalues against others, it loses its value
devalue.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: With more money coming into circulation, the ruble may devalue further.
